alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Curry County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:44PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT ROOSEVELT...EASTERN CHAVES AND SOUTHERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM MDT... At 644 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Melrose to near Kenna. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Farwell, Texico, Melrose, Elida, Dora, Floyd, Causey, and Saint Vrain. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 361 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Curry County; Roosevelt County
